property_tycoon.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • property_tycoon.model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a board. An object of this class is called using arrays of board positions and players. It's directly instantiated once by the graphical user interface.
    Version:
    01/05/2018
    Author:
    meme-team

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(BoardPosition[] positions, Player[] players)
      Constructs a board.

      Returns the next board position from the passed in position.
      BoardPosition getPosition(int index)
      Returns the position from the array located at the passed in index.
      BoardPosition getPosition(Player of)
      Returns the position from the array on which the passed in player is located at.
      int getPositionCount()
      Returns the number of positions in this board.

      Returns the previous board position from the passed in position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(BoardPosition[] positions,
             Player[] players)
        Constructs a board. The passed in board positions and players become this object's board positions and players.
        Parameters:
        positions - This board's positions.
        players - This board's players.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed in positions array is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are no positions in the position array.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a null position in the position array.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed in players array is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are no players in the player array.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a null player in the player array.

      • getNext

        public BoardPosition getNext(BoardPosition position)
        Returns the next board position from the passed in position.
        Parameters:
        position - The original board position.
        Returns:
        The next position on the board.

      • getPrevious

        public BoardPosition getPrevious(BoardPosition position)
        Returns the previous board position from the passed in position.
        Parameters:
        position - The original board position.
        Returns:
        The previous position on the board.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(BoardPosition position)
        Returns the index of the passed in board position in the position array.
        Parameters:
        position - The board position.
        Returns:
        The index of position within the board position array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed in position is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position doesn't exist in the position array.

      • getPosition

        public BoardPosition getPosition(int index)
        Returns the position from the array located at the passed in index.
        Parameters:
        index - The array index.
        Returns:
        The position within the array at the index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds of the array.

      • getPosition

        public BoardPosition getPosition(Player of)
        Returns the position from the array on which the passed in player is located at.
        Parameters:
        of - The player.
        Returns:
        The board position that the player is located at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the player is a null object.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed in player is not in this object's player array.

      • getPositionCount

        public int getPositionCount()
        Returns the number of positions in this board.
        Returns:
        The number of positions objects in the board position array.
